lexUnit.name: skirt.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: the part of a coat or dress that hangs below the waist.

sentence.text: It was an old ewe , treading on the skirt of her raincoat , that roused Elisabeth .
He caught up the skirts of his robe and scurried after them .
With the ornaments cradled in the skirt of her large white apron , she attempted a smile .
` Willingly ! " said the earl , and turned to descend the three steps , the skirts of his crimson surcoat swirling around him .
She pinched her cheeks quickly to add a little colour , and straightened the skirt of her plum-coloured sweater-dress before squaring her slim shoulders and resuming her descent .
Or huge satin ballgown skirts in shocking pink or lilac satin topped with rib-hugging knits for the new dance-in-a-cold-climate look .
Like a great-breasted pigeon , she preened her feathers along the low corsage of her dress , and spread her velvet skirts into perfect order as she sat down .
For the loyal Reds follower choose her wedding outfit in the team colours a dress with red bodice and white crinoline skirt topped by white bowler hat and veil .
On another day when I asked the question , she began slowly and with difficulty to lift the skirts of her dress , revealing bare knees .
He came to meet her so fast that the skirt of his white coat floated out behind him .
He touched the hilt of the hiranu in his waist sash , then stood , smoothing the skirts of his coat .
Alexei was looking down at the skirts of his coat .
Louise smiled a slow smile , and smoothed down the skirt of her dress .
The skirt of her cotton print dress was crumpled and stained and one sleeve was ripped where she had caught it on a wicker chicken cage in a village market place .
She hitched the full skirt of her Summer dress up above her knees , and swung her long legs for him to see .
